newsitem.title: UK: BSkyB to order digital decoders soon.
newsitem.headline: BSkyB to order digital decoders soon.

text.p: British Sky Broadcasting Plc, which plans to launch digital satellite television into the UK this autumn, said on Wednesday it expected to order up to one million digital decoders from four manufacturers imminently.
"We expect to confirm orders with four manufacturers for up to one million decoders imminently," BSkyB deputy managing director David Chance told a news conference.
BSKyB executives said they were not able to disclose the identity of the four companies involved.

However, Britain's Pace Micro Technology Plc last week confirmed that it was one of four candidates to make decoders for BSkyB, although it said it had not been advised by the broadcaster of firm plans.
Other firms cited in media reports along with Pace are Panasonic, Sony Corp and Nokia.
